what: Assemble Multiple Citations with APA Formatting — ngr_cite_assemble
title: Assemble Multiple Citations with APA Formatting — ngr_cite_assemble
text: Assembles list citations single inline reference, using semicolons.

title: Assemble Multiple Citations with APA Formatting — ngr_cite_assemble
Assemble Multiple Citations with APA Formatting — ngr_cite_assemble
text: citations vector citation strings.

title: Assemble Multiple Citations with APA Formatting — ngr_cite_assemble
text: single string citations separated semicolons.

title: Format Multiple Citations — ngr_cite_format
text: Formats one citation keys single inline reference.

title: Format Multiple Citations — ngr_cite_format
Format Multiple Citations — ngr_cite_format
text: raw_key raw citation key string, possibly brackets. bib_obj bibliography object. ... Additional arguments passed main function.

title: Format Multiple Citations — ngr_cite_format
text: Formatted citation string.

what: Format a Single Citation for Inline Text — ngr_cite_format_single
title: Format a Single Citation for Inline Text — ngr_cite_format_single
text: Formats single citation key inline text without brackets.

title: Format a Single Citation for Inline Text — ngr_cite_format_single
Format a Single Citation for Inline Text — ngr_cite_format_single
text: key citation key. bib_obj bibliography object created reading .bib file RefManageR::ReadBib. key_abort_on_missing Logical. TRUE, aborts missing citation keys. ... Additional arguments passed main function.

title: Format a Single Citation for Inline Text — ngr_cite_format_single
text: Formatted citation string.

what: Transform Citation Keys in a Data Frame Column — ngr_cite_keys_table_col
title: Transform Citation Keys in a Data Frame Column — ngr_cite_keys_table_col
text: function applies ngr_cite_keys_to_inline transformation specified column data frame. validates inputs, checks specified column exists data frame, replaces contents transformed values.

title: Transform Citation Keys in a Data Frame Column — ngr_cite_keys_table_col
code: ngr_cite_keys_table_col(   dat = NULL,   col_format = NULL,   bib_file = "references.bib" )

title: Transform Citation Keys in a Data Frame Column — ngr_cite_keys_table_col
text: dat data frame containing column transform. col_format string specifying name column transform. bib_file file path bibliography file (.bib) used citation keys. Defaults "references.bib" current working directory.

title: Transform Citation Keys in a Data Frame Column — ngr_cite_keys_table_col
text: data frame specified column transformed.

title: Transform Citation Keys in a Data Frame Column — ngr_cite_keys_table_col
code: # Example data frame df <- data.frame(   id = 1:3,   bib_keys = c("key1", "key2", "key3") )  # Apply the transformation result <- ngr_cite_keys_table_col(df, col_format = "bib_keys") #> Error in ngr_cite_keys_to_inline(x, bib_file = bib_file): The specified bibliography file does not exist: references.bib

what: Convert Citation Keys to Inline References — ngr_cite_keys_to_inline
title: Convert Citation Keys to Inline References — ngr_cite_keys_to_inline
text: function processes block text containing citation keys (e.g., @doe2020) converts inline references using Pandoc. function supports custom bibliography CSL (Citation Style Language) files.

title: Convert Citation Keys to Inline References — ngr_cite_keys_to_inline
Convert Citation Keys to Inline References — ngr_cite_keys_to_inline
text: text character vector containing text citation keys (e.g., @doe2020). bib_file string specifying path bibliography file (e.g., references.bib). csl_file string specifying path CSL file (e.g., apa.csl). Default NULL, uses Pandoc's default citation style.

title: Convert Citation Keys to Inline References — ngr_cite_keys_to_inline
text: character vector inline references replacing citation keys.

what: We probably just want to use ngr_cite_keys_table_col or ngr_cite_keys_to_inline but this will Generate Cross-reference Data Frame with Original Keys in One Column and Inline APA-Style Citations in Another. — ngr_cite_keys_to_xref
title: We probably just want to use ngr_cite_keys_table_col or ngr_cite_keys_to_inline but this will Generate Cross-reference Data Frame with Original Keys in One Column and Inline APA-Style Citations in Another. — ngr_cite_keys_to_xref
text: function takes citation keys passed list generates inline APA-style references item list.

title: We probably just want to use ngr_cite_keys_table_col or ngr_cite_keys_to_inline but this will Generate Cross-reference Data Frame with Original Keys in One Column and Inline APA-Style Citations in Another. — ngr_cite_keys_to_xref
code: ngr_cite_keys_to_xref(   citation_keys,   bib_file,   key_abort_on_missing = TRUE,   key_check_response = "warn" )

title: We probably just want to use ngr_cite_keys_table_col or ngr_cite_keys_to_inline but this will Generate Cross-reference Data Frame with Original Keys in One Column and Inline APA-Style Citations in Another. — ngr_cite_keys_to_xref
text: citation_keys character vector citation keys. bib_file Path .bib bibliography file. key_abort_on_missing Logical. TRUE, aborts missing citation keys. key_check_response Response level missing fields bib entries. Default "warn". Passed ReadBib RefManageR package

title: We probably just want to use ngr_cite_keys_table_col or ngr_cite_keys_to_inline but this will Generate Cross-reference Data Frame with Original Keys in One Column and Inline APA-Style Citations in Another. — ngr_cite_keys_to_xref
text: data frame citation keys one column formatted inline references another.

title: We probably just want to use ngr_cite_keys_table_col or ngr_cite_keys_to_inline but this will Generate Cross-reference Data Frame with Original Keys in One Column and Inline APA-Style Citations in Another. — ngr_cite_keys_to_xref
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ bib_file <- "path/to/references.bib" citation_keys <- c("@smith2000", "[@smith2001; @doe2005]") ngr_cite_keys_to_xref(citation_keys, bib_file) } # }
